Abstract: Vice Pres Al Gore plays up some facts and ignores others when he accuses Bill Bradley, his challenger for Democratic Presidential nomination, of taking large amounts of campaign cash from drug companies and doing their bidding during his 18 years in Senate, while painting himself as the consumer's advocate in Washington against predatory drug manufacturers; Bradley has championed some legislation favored by pharmaceutical companies, many of the based in New Jersey, his home, but Clinton-Gore administration has also helped pharmaceutical companies on certain issues, and Clinton-Gore ticket took plenty of money from drug companies, too (M)
Snippet: Vice Pres Al Gore plays up some facts and ignores others when he accuses Bill Bradley, his challenger for Democratic Presidential nomination, of taking large amounts of campaign cash from drug companies and doing their bidding during his 18 years ...
LeadParagraph: Vice President Gore has denounced former Senator Bill Bradley for taking large amounts of campaign cash from drug companies and, Mr. Gore says, doing their bidding during his 18 years in the Senate.

Headline.Main: Gore's Latest Attack on Bradley Tells Only Part of Story
Headline.PrintHeadline: Gore's Latest Attack on Bradley Tells Only Part of Story
